history.narrative: Law 17-314, the “Anti-Littering Amendment Act of 2008”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 17-26 which was referred to the Committees on Public Safety and the Judiciary, Public Works and the Environment. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on November 18, 2008, and December 2, 2008, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on December 22, 2008, it was assigned Act No. 17-618 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 17-314 became effective on March 20, 2009.
